sinaiticus.text: Paul, a servant of God, but an apostle of Christ Jesus, according to the faith of God’s elect, and the acknowledgment of truth that is according to godliness,

verses.text: Paul, a servant of God, but an apostle of Christ Jesus, according to the faith of God’s elect, and the acknowledgment of truth that is according to godliness,

sinaiticus.text: in hope of eternal life, which God who lies not promised before the times of the ages,

verses.text: in hope of eternal life, which God who lies not promised before the times of the ages,

sinaiticus.text: but in his own times manifested his word in what is preached, with which I was intrusted according to the appointment of our Saviour God,

verses.text: but in his own times manifested his word in what is preached, with which I was intrusted according to the appointment of our Saviour God,

sinaiticus.text: to Titus, my true son according to the common faith. Grace and peace from God the Father, and Christ Jesus our Saviour.

verses.text: to Titus, my true son according to the common faith. Grace and peace from God the Father, and Christ Jesus our Saviour.

sinaiticus.text: For this cause left I thee in Crete, that thou mightest further set in order the things that are wanting, and ordain elders in every city, as I had appointed thee:

verses.text: For this cause left I thee in Crete, that thou mightest further set in order the things that are wanting, and ordain elders in every city, as I had appointed thee:

sinaiticus.text: if any one is blameless, the husband of one wife, having faithful children that are not accused of riotous living, nor unruly.

verses.text: if any one is blameless, the husband of one wife, having faithful children that are not accused of riotous living, nor unruly.

sinaiticus.text: For the bishop must be blameless as the steward of God, not self- willed, not soon angry, not fond of wine, no striker, not eager after base gain,

verses.text: For the bishop must be blameless as the steward of God, not self- willed, not soon angry, not fond of wine, no striker, not eager after base gain,

sinaiticus.text: but a lover of hospitality, a lover of the good, sober-minded, just, holy, having self-control,

verses.text: but a lover of hospitality, a lover of the good, sober-minded, just, holy, having self-control,

sinaiticus.text: holding fast the faithful word according to the teaching, that he may be able, in the teaching that gives health, both to exhort and convince the gainsayers.

verses.text: holding fast the faithful word according to the teaching, that he may be able, in the teaching that gives health, both to exhort and convince the gainsayers.

sinaiticus.text: For there are many and unruly vain talkers and deceivers, especially they of the circumcision,

verses.text: For there are many and unruly vain talkers and deceivers, especially they of the circumcision,

sinaiticus.text: whose mouths must be stopped: who subvert whole houses, teaching things that they ought not, for the sake of base gain.

verses.text: whose mouths must be stopped: who subvert whole houses, teaching things that they ought not, for the sake of base gain.

sinaiticus.text: Some one of them, a prophet of their own, has said: The Cretans are always liars, evil wild beasts, lazy bellies.

verses.text: Some one of them, a prophet of their own, has said: The Cretans are always liars, evil wild beasts, lazy bellies.

sinaiticus.text: This testimony is true. For which cause reprove them with severity, that they may be healthy in the faith,

verses.text: This testimony is true. For which cause reprove them with severity, that they may be healthy in the faith,

sinaiticus.text: not giving heed to Jewish fables, and commandments of men that turn away from the truth.

verses.text: not giving heed to Jewish fables, and commandments of men that turn away from the truth.

sinaiticus.text: To the pure all things are pure; but to the defiled and unbelieving nothing is pure, but both their mind and conscience are defiled.

verses.text: To the pure all things are pure; but to the defiled and unbelieving nothing is pure, but both their mind and conscience are defiled.

sinaiticus.text: God they profess to know, but in their works they deny him, being abominable and disobedient and, with regard to every good work, disapproved.

verses.text: God they profess to know, but in their works they deny him, being abominable and disobedient and, with regard to every good work, disapproved.

sinaiticus.text: But speak thou the things that become the teaching that gives health.

verses.text: But speak thou the things that become the teaching that gives health.

sinaiticus.text: That aged men be watchful, grave, sober-minded, healthy in faith, in love, in patience:

verses.text: That aged men be watchful, grave, sober-minded, healthy in faith, in love, in patience:

sinaiticus.text: that aged women in like manner be, in behavior, reverent, not false accusers, not addicted to much wine, teachers of what is good,

verses.text: that aged women in like manner be, in behavior, reverent, not false accusers, not addicted to much wine, teachers of what is good,

sinaiticus.text: that they teach the young women to love their husbands, to love their children,

verses.text: that they teach the young women to love their husbands, to love their children,

sinaiticus.text: to be sober-minded, chaste, workers at home, good, obedient to their own husbands, that the word of God be not blasphemed.

verses.text: to be sober-minded, chaste, workers at home, good, obedient to their own husbands, that the word of God be not blasphemed.

sinaiticus.text: The younger men in like manner exhort to be sober-minded,

verses.text: The younger men in like manner exhort to be sober-minded,

sinaiticus.text: in all things showing thyself an example of good works, in teaching showing uncorruptness, gravity.

verses.text: in all things showing thyself an example of good works, in teaching showing uncorruptness, gravity.

sinaiticus.text: healthful speech that can not be condemned, that the opponent may be ashamed, having nothing evil to say of us.

verses.text: healthful speech that can not be condemned, that the opponent may be ashamed, having nothing evil to say of us.

sinaiticus.text: Servants exhort to be subject to their own masters, to be acceptable to them in all things, not contradicting,

verses.text: Servants exhort to be subject to their own masters, to be acceptable to them in all things, not contradicting,

sinaiticus.text: not taking a part for themselves, but showing all good faithfulness. that they may adorn the teaching of our Saviour God in all things.

verses.text: not taking a part for themselves, but showing all good faithfulness. that they may adorn the teaching of our Saviour God in all things.

sinaiticus.text: For the grace of God that brings salvation to all men has appeared,

verses.text: For the grace of God that brings salvation to all men has appeared,

sinaiticus.text: instructing us, that, denying ungodliness and worldly desires, we should live soberly and righteously and godly in the present age,

verses.text: instructing us, that, denying ungodliness and worldly desires, we should live soberly and righteously and godly in the present age,

sinaiticus.text: waiting for the blessed hope, and the appearing of the glory of our great God and Saviour Jesus Christ,

verses.text: waiting for the blessed hope, and the appearing of the glory of our great God and Saviour Jesus Christ,

sinaiticus.text: who gave himself for us that he might redeem us from all iniquity, and purify for himself a peculiar people, zealous for good works.

verses.text: who gave himself for us that he might redeem us from all iniquity, and purify for himself a peculiar people, zealous for good works.

sinaiticus.text: These things speak and exhort and reprove with all authority: let no one despise thee.

verses.text: These things speak and exhort and reprove with all authority: let no one despise thee.

sinaiticus.text: Put them in mind to be subject to rulers, to authorities, to obey, to be ready for every good work,

verses.text: Put them in mind to be subject to rulers, to authorities, to obey, to be ready for every good work,

sinaiticus.text: to revile no one, to be without contention, gentle, showing all meekness to all men.

verses.text: to revile no one, to be without contention, gentle, showing all meekness to all men.

sinaiticus.text: For we also were once foolish, disobedient, deceived, serving various desires and pleasures, living in malice and envy, hateful and hating one another;

verses.text: For we also were once foolish, disobedient, deceived, serving various desires and pleasures, living in malice and envy, hateful and hating one another;

sinaiticus.text: but when the kindness and philanthropy of our Saviour God appeared,

verses.text: but when the kindness and philanthropy of our Saviour God appeared,

sinaiticus.text: not by works of righteousness which we had done, but according to his mercy, he saved us through the bath of regeneration and renewing of the Holy Spirit,386

verses.text: not by works of righteousness which we had done, but according to his mercy, he saved us through the bath of regeneration and renewing of the Holy Spirit,386

sinaiticus.text: which he poured out upon us richly through Jesus Christ our Saviour,

verses.text: which he poured out upon us richly through Jesus Christ our Saviour,

sinaiticus.text: that having been justified by his grace, we might become heirs according to the hope of life eternal.

verses.text: that having been justified by his grace, we might become heirs according to the hope of life eternal.

sinaiticus.text: Faithful is the saying, and concerning these things I will that thou affirm strongly, in order that those that believe in God may be careful to practice good works. These things are honorable and profitable for men;

verses.text: Faithful is the saying, and concerning these things I will that thou affirm strongly, in order that those that believe in God may be careful to practice good works. These things are honorable and profitable for men;

sinaiticus.text: but foolish questions, and genealogies, and strifes, and contentions about law, reject; for they are unprofitable and fruitless.

verses.text: but foolish questions, and genealogies, and strifes, and contentions about law, reject; for they are unprofitable and fruitless.

sinaiticus.text: An heretical man, after the first and second admonition, reject,

verses.text: An heretical man, after the first and second admonition, reject,

sinaiticus.text: knowing that such a man is perverted, and sins, being self- condemned.

verses.text: knowing that such a man is perverted, and sins, being self- condemned.

sinaiticus.text: When I shall send Artemas to thee, or Tychicus, be diligent to come to me to Nicopolis: for there have I determined to winter.

verses.text: When I shall send Artemas to thee, or Tychicus, be diligent to come to me to Nicopolis: for there have I determined to winter.

sinaiticus.text: Zenas, the lawyer, and Apollos send forward diligently, that nothing be wanting to them.

verses.text: Zenas, the lawyer, and Apollos send forward diligently, that nothing be wanting to them.

sinaiticus.text: But let ours also learn to practice honorable works for necessary uses, that they be not unfruitful.

verses.text: But let ours also learn to practice honorable works for necessary uses, that they be not unfruitful.

sinaiticus.text: All that are with me salute thee. Salute those that love us in the faith.

verses.text: All that are with me salute thee. Salute those that love us in the faith.
